content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>f</mi></math> be the function defined by <math alttext="f of x equals, x cubed, plus x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>f</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>x</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></mpadded></math>. If <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>g</mi></math> is the inverse function of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>f</mi></math>, what is the slope of the line tangent to the graph of <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>g</mi></math> at the point <math alttext="with coordinates 2 comma 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mn>2</mn></mpadded><mo>,</mo><mpadded><mn>1</mn></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> ?

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
